## Grayscale

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(test_task, acc), size = 1) +
  geom_point(data = sub_data, colour = "gray85") +
  geom_point(aes(colour = Analysis), show.legend = FALSE) +
  scale_y_continuous(
  name = "Accuracy %",
  limits = c(0,1.1),
  breaks = seq(0,1,.25) 
  ) +
scale_x_discrete(
  name = "Test Task"
) +
  scale_color_manual(labels = c("Same Person", "Different Person"), values = c("#D55E00D0", "#0072B2D0")) +
  facet_grid(Analysis~train_task) +
  theme(panel.spacing = unit(2, "lines")) +
  theme_minimal()
  
  

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
